definitions.example: Consider that we’ve had three major events and the year has hardly begun.

definitions.definition: To think about something seriously or carefully: to deliberate.

definitions.example: I’m considering going to the beach tomorrow.
Consider yourself lucky, but consider your opponent skillful.
She sat there for a moment, considering him.

definitions.definition: To take up as an example.
definitions.example: Consider a triangle having three equal sides.

definitions.definition: (parliamentary procedure) To debate (or dispose of) a motion.
definitions.example: This body will now consider the proposed amendments to Section 453 of the zoning code.

definitions.definition: To have regard to; to take into view or account; to pay due attention to; to respect.
definitions.example: He never seems to consider the feelings of others.
Your wound doesn't look that bad, considering.
Considering the extent of his crimes, he was given a surprisingly short sentence.
